pullRequest.body:
Uses non-differentiability to generalize statements about deriv of MulLog

---

Moved over from PR #9734.

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10330181602/job/28598864359)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10330181602/job/28598864269)

Looks good, thanks a lot for your patience! I just have a few final comments but otherwise let's merge this.

bors d+

Looks good, thanks a lot for your patience! I just have a few final comments but otherwise let's merge this.

bors d+

@dupuisf  said (in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9734#discussion_r1669502767)
> I think these could be generalized to something like
> 
> ```
> lemma not_continuousAt_of_tendsto {f : ℝ → ℝ} {l₁ l₂ : Filter ℝ} (x : ℝ)
>     (hf : Tendsto f l₁ l₂) [l₁.NeBot] (hl₁ : l₁ ≤ 𝓝 x) (hl₂ : l₂ ⊓ 𝓝 (f x) = ⊥) :
>     ¬ ContinuousAt f x := by sorry
> ```
> 
> (but properly generalized to more than just real functions). Or they could just be inlined since the proofs are quite short anyway. I think having the lemma would be nice, since it's a bit more discoverable than having to resort to lemmas about tendsto.

Assuming I could prove that, not sure how to use this not_continuousAt_of_tendsto. For example, to specialize to my case, automation doesn't seem to do it and the best I could come up with is
```lean
lemma not_continuousAt_of_tendsto_nhdsWithin_Ioi_atTop {f : ℝ → ℝ} {x : ℝ}
    (hf : Tendsto f (𝓝[>] x) atTop) :
    ¬ ContinuousAt f x := by
  apply not_continuousAt_of_tendsto x hf nhdsWithin_le_nhds
  apply inf_eq_bot_iff.mpr
  use Set.Ioi (f x + 2)
  constructor
  · exact Ioi_mem_atTop (f x + 2)
  · use Set.Ioo (f x - 1) (f x + 1)
    constructor
    · exact Ioo_mem_nhds (by linarith) (by linarith)
    · rw [Set.Ioi_inter_Ioo]
      simp only [max_lt_iff, add_lt_add_iff_left, Nat.not_ofNat_lt_one, false_and,
        not_false_eq_true, Set.Ioo_eq_empty]
```
Ideally, one would need more lemmas (or something else?) such that exact? or aesop can prove this.

`inf_nhds_atTop` kill off that last one:
```lean
lemma not_continuousAt_of_tendsto_nhdsWithin_Ioi_atTop' {f : ℝ → ℝ} {x : ℝ}
    (hf : Tendsto f (𝓝[>] x) atTop) :
    ¬ ContinuousAt f x := by
  apply not_continuousAt_of_tendsto x hf nhdsWithin_le_nhds
  simp only [inf_comm, inf_nhds_atTop]
```

Any way we can get automation to prove this? As it stands currently, having  `not_continuousAt_of_tendsto` in Mathlib would most likely not have helped me prove `not_continuousAt_of_tendsto_nhdsWithin_Ioi_atTop`.

Meanwhile, [inf_nhds_atTop](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Order/OrderClosed.html#inf_nhds_atTop) is even marked `@[simp]` but `simp` does not find it, I guess because it's missing `inf_comm`.
Probably the easiest way to get automation to work is to have `inf_atTop_nhds` as well, since `inf_comm` would be a bad simp lemma.
Sounds good. Can I add `inf_atTop_nhds` in this PR or does it need another separate one?

I'm confused about the hypothesis above: `hl₁ : l₁ ≤ 𝓝 x`. I can prove it with the comparison reversed
```lean
lemma not_continuousAt_of_tendsto' {f : ℝ → ℝ} {l₁ l₂ : Filter ℝ} (x : ℝ)
    (hf : Tendsto f l₁ l₂) [l₁.NeBot] (hl₁ : 𝓝 x ≤ l₁) (hl₂ : l₂ ⊓ 𝓝 (f x) = ⊥) :
    ¬ ContinuousAt f x := fun cont ↦ 
  (cont.tendsto.not_tendsto (disjoint_iff.mpr hl₂).symm) (hf.mono_left hl₁)
```
which seems to suggest that either the hypothesis is not needed or the lemma you stated is false? (Edit: I guess it's actually neither because the order is not total?)

Both are true and I proved the other direction:

@dupuisf how to proceed with this? Should I add these lemmas to the PR? Or will you make a completely different API for proving non-differentiable and these lemmas are unnecessary?

I guess `hl₂` could be replaced by `Disjoint`, though I'm not sure if that's helpful or not.  Could the two lemmas (both comparisons) be combined into one in some nice way? I guess one can also avoid adding `inf_atTop_nhds` by using `hl : 𝓝 (f x) ⊓ l₂ = ⊥` instead. Maybe like this?
```lean
lemma not_continuousAt_of_tendsto {f : ℝ → ℝ} {l₁ l₂ : Filter ℝ} {x : ℝ}
    (hf : Tendsto f l₁ l₂) [l₁.NeBot] (hl₁ : l₁ ≤ 𝓝 x) (hl₂ : Disjoint (𝓝 (f x)) l₂) :
    ¬ ContinuousAt f x := fun cont ↦
  (((ContinuousAt.tendsto_iff.mp cont).mono_left hl₁).not_tendsto hl₂) hf

lemma not_continuousAt_of_tendsto_nhdsWithin_Ioi_atTop' {f : ℝ → ℝ} {x : ℝ}
    (hf : Tendsto f (𝓝[>] x) atTop) :
    ¬ ContinuousAt f x := by
  apply not_continuousAt_of_tendsto hf nhdsWithin_le_nhds
  simp
```

Hmm, I think the right way to combine `l₁ ≤ 𝓝 x` and `𝓝 x ≤ l₁` is `ClusterPt x l₁`, and likewise `hl₂` would be `hl₂ : ¬ ClusterPt (f x) l₂`.

I think it's perfectly fine to add this material in this PR.

Thanks for the suggestion. On first glance, it doesn't look like `ClusterPt` has a lot of lemmas about it that can be used here (e.g., that allow an easy proof of `not_continuousAt_of_tendsto_nhdsWithin_Ioi_atTop` using a version of `not_continuousAt_of_tendsto` that uses `ClusterPt`). Maybe I'll stick with the current version so-far.
I moved a version of `not_continuousAt_of_tendsto` that uses `Disjoint` but not `ClusterPt` to `Mathlib/Topology/Basic.lean`.

On second thought, going through `IsLittleO` is probably not the best way. I think we need lemmas that say that if `deriv f` tendsto `atTop` (or `atBot`) in the neighborhood of some point, then `f` is not differentiable at that point. This could probably go in `MeanValue.lean`. With this it should follow directly from that lemma. Unfortunately we have very few lemmas saying that a function is *not* differentiable...

I could have a crack at it in the next few days if you've had enough!

> I could have a crack at it in the next few days if you've had enough!

Sure, go ahead. Even if I could probably prove those things given some time, I certainly wouldn't get the API right on the first few tries.

Alright, these two lemmas should do it (with `atBot` and `𝓝[<] a)` versions):
```lean
theorem ContinuousWithinAt.mono_nhdsWithin  {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [TopologicalSpace α]
    [TopologicalSpace β] {f : α → β} {s₁ s₂ : Set α} {x : α}
    (h : ContinuousWithinAt f s₁ x) (h_nhds : 𝓝[s₂] x ≤ 𝓝[s₁] x) : ContinuousWithinAt f s₂ x :=
  calc (𝓝[s₂] x).map f ≤ (𝓝[s₁] x).map f := by gcongr
    _ ≤ 𝓝 (f x) := h

theorem not_differentiableAt_of_deriv_tendsto_atTop_Ioi (f : ℝ → ℝ) {a : ℝ}
    (hf : Tendsto (deriv f) (𝓝[>] a) atTop) : ¬ DifferentiableAt ℝ f a := by
  by_cases hcont_at_a : ¬ ContinuousWithinAt f (Ici a) a
  · exact fun hcontra => hcont_at_a <| hcontra.continuousAt.continuousWithinAt
  · push_neg at hcont_at_a
    intro hdiff
    have hdiff₂ := hdiff.hasDerivAt
    rw [hasDerivAt_iff_tendsto_slope] at hdiff₂
    replace hdiff₂ : Tendsto (slope f a) (𝓝[>] a) (𝓝 (deriv f a)) :=
      hdiff₂.mono_left <| nhds_right'_le_nhds_ne a
    have h₁ : ∀ᶠ b in (𝓝[>] a), ∀ x ∈ Ioc a b, deriv f a + 1 < deriv f x := by
      rw [(nhdsWithin_Ioi_basis a).eventually_iff]
      rw [(nhdsWithin_Ioi_basis a).tendsto_left_iff] at hf
      obtain ⟨b, hab, hb⟩ := hf (Ioi (deriv f a + 1)) (Ioi_mem_atTop _)
      refine ⟨b, hab, fun x hx z hz => ?_⟩
      simp only [MapsTo, mem_Ioo, mem_Ioi, and_imp] at hb
      exact hb hz.1 <| hz.2.trans_lt hx.2
    have h₂ : ∀ᶠ b in (𝓝[>] a), slope f a b < (deriv f a) + (1 : ℝ) := by
      rw [(nhds_basis_Ioo _).tendsto_right_iff] at hdiff₂
      specialize hdiff₂ ⟨deriv f a - 1, deriv f a + 1⟩ <| by simp
      filter_upwards [hdiff₂] with z hz using hz.2
    have h₃ : ∀ᶠ b in (𝓝[>] a), ∀ x ∈ Ioc a b, 0 < deriv f x := by
      rw [(nhdsWithin_Ioi_basis a).eventually_iff]
      rw [(nhdsWithin_Ioi_basis a).tendsto_left_iff] at hf
      obtain ⟨b, hab, hb⟩ := hf (Ioi 0) (Ioi_mem_atTop 0)
      refine ⟨b, hab, fun x hx z hz => ?_⟩
      simp only [MapsTo, mem_Ioo, mem_Ioi, and_imp] at hb
      exact hb hz.1 <| hz.2.trans_lt hx.2
    have hcontra : ∀ᶠ _ in (𝓝[>] a), False := by
      filter_upwards [h₁, h₂, h₃, eventually_mem_nhdsWithin] with
        b hb hslope hderiv_pos (hab : a < b)
      have hdiff' : DifferentiableOn ℝ f (Ioc a b) := fun z hz => by
        have : deriv f z ≠ 0 := Ne.symm <| ne_of_lt <| hderiv_pos z hz
        exact DifferentiableAt.differentiableWithinAt <| differentiableAt_of_deriv_ne_zero this
      have hcont : ContinuousOn f (Icc a b) := by
        intro z hz
        by_cases hz' : z = a
        · rw [hz']
          exact hcont_at_a.mono Icc_subset_Ici_self
        · have hz'' : z ∈ Ioc a b := ⟨lt_of_le_of_ne hz.1 (Ne.symm hz'), hz.2⟩
          refine (hdiff'.continuousOn z hz'').mono_nhdsWithin ?_
          by_cases hz''' : z = b
          · rw [hz''', nhdsWithin_Ioc_eq_nhdsWithin_Iic hab, nhdsWithin_Icc_eq_nhdsWithin_Iic hab]
          · have hfinal₁ : 𝓝[Ioc a b] z = 𝓝 z := by
              rw [nhdsWithin_eq_nhds]
              refine Ioc_mem_nhds ?_ (lt_of_le_of_ne hz.2 hz''')
              simp_all only [mem_Ioc, and_imp, mem_Icc, and_true]
            have hfinal₂ : 𝓝[Icc a b] z = 𝓝 z := by
              rw [nhdsWithin_eq_nhds]
              exact Icc_mem_nhds (lt_of_le_of_ne hz.1 (ne_of_lt hz''.1)) (lt_of_le_of_ne hz.2 hz''')
            rw [hfinal₁, hfinal₂]
      obtain ⟨x, hx₁, hx₂⟩ := exists_deriv_eq_slope' f hab hcont (hdiff'.mono Ioo_subset_Ioc_self)
      specialize hb x (mem_Ioc_of_Ioo hx₁)
      rw [hx₂] at hb
      linarith
    simp [Filter.eventually_false_iff_eq_bot, ← not_mem_closure_iff_nhdsWithin_eq_bot] at hcontra
```
Do you want to add these to this PR, or would you prefer it if I PRed them separately?

Wow, that's a much bigger proof than I expected. Maybe I wouldn't have found it after all... Thanks! 

Is `exists_deriv_eq_slope'` missing? (Replacing it by `exists_deriv_eq_slope` leads to the subsequent `linarith` failing). Maybe you could either push to this branch or make a new PR?

Indeed `exists_deriv_eq_slope'` is missing from that code snippet (it's the same as `exists_deriv_eq_slope` but it actually uses `slope`). I'll just open a separate PR, I think it's a bit easier (also that means I'm not too involved in this one to finish reviewing it). Once that is merged, you can just merge master into this one.
Here's the PR: #15200
Used this lemma. Removed auxiliary stuff.
nit: I think `x` can be changed to an explicit parameter if `hx` is removed
nit: I think `x` can be changed to an explicit parameter if `hx` is removed

```suggestion
/-- At `x=0`, `(fun x ↦ x * log x)` is not differentiable (but note that it is continuous, see `continuous_mul_log`). -/
```
I think just a simple one line description will do, like "If a function `f` tends to somewhere other than `𝓝 (f x)` at `x`, then `f` is not continuous at `x`".

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Generalize statements about deriv of MulLog
